checklist-1.caption: Students can access information, regardless of their sensory abilities.

table.task: Include alternative text for all images, graphics, shapes, and PivotTables.
Ensure alt-text for images of text includes the text content from that image.
Provide transcripts for pre-recorded, externally linked audio content.
Include captions for pre-recorded, externally linked video content.
Use a simple structure with column headers and avoid blank, merged, or split cells.
Avoid blank rows or columns, and nested tables to preserve information relationships.
Never rely solely on color, shape, size, or visual location to convey information.
Use a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 for text to ensure readability.
Present all text in actual text format rather than as images of text.

checklist-2.caption: Students can easily navigate and use the spreadsheet regardless of how they interact with computers.

table.task: Ensure all functionality is accessible using only the keyboard.
Confirm that focus can be moved to and away from all elements using only the keyboard.
Avoid content that flashes more than three times per second to prevent seizures.
Give each sheet tab a unique, descriptive name to make content easily identifiable.
Remove blank sheets to improve navigation and searchability.
Use descriptive text for hyperlinks instead of phrases like 'click here'.
Add ScreenTips to hyperlinks to provide additional context.
Provide multiple ways to locate or navigate to content (e.g., custom menu sheet).
Deactivate floating toolbars before sharing to make data more accessible.
Avoid using 'freeze pane', 'hide columns' features, or text boxes when possible.

checklist-3.caption: Students can easily understand how to use a spreadsheet, and comprehend its information.

table.task: Use consistency in formatting across all sheets and content.
Apply consistent naming conventions throughout the spreadsheet.
Ensure sheets that serve parallel functions follow the same basic structure.
Define acronyms and abbreviations the first time they appear.
Use clear, simple language in all labels, instructions, and content.

checklist-4.caption: Students can access the spreadsheet using different technologies and tools that help them learn.

table.task: Run the Excel Accessibility Checker tool to find and fix problems.
Run the checker again after making changes to catch any new issues.
Consider sharing as a .csv file if the spreadsheet contains only data.
Add document properties like title, author, and tags for better identification.
